result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M. Finley

Attorney J. Eric Olson in court for Christopher M. Finley.
Attorney Brendaliz Valdes in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court Reporter:  Tracy Czarnecki-Kozmer.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
21CF760, 22CF435, 22CF1207:
Victim rights compliance.
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time,
def. trying to get in to the Drug Court.
Matter set over, bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Minutes:  22CF1207/21CF760/22CF435.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody along w/Atty Eric Olson.  Defense requests an adjournment; attempting to get the deft into Drug Treatment Court.  No objection by the State.  Status set for 11/1/22 @ 9:45am.

Defendant Christopher M. Finley in court, in custody.  Attorney J. Eric Olson in court for Christopher M. Finley.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia

02:04 PM   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.   Defendant is on a PO Hold. $500 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). mi
